title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
00:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:37 <Denis> has quit  
02:19 <vmassol> has quit  
02:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:41 <vmassol> has quit  
05:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
05:34 <Denis> has quit  
05:34 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis1> has quit  
07:17 <vmassol> has quit  
07:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <cjd> has quit  
08:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: hi  
09:07 <vmassol> forget it ;)  
09:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: cool :)  
09:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw you forgot to update http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications  
09:10 <vmassol> I'm doing it now  
09:12 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> done  
09:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: thanks  
09:21 <j-simard> has left #xwiki  
09:22 <cjd> I'd like to release XWiki 5.2.1 tomorrow since it contains lots of  
09:22 <cjd> important regressions... <-- nice wording  
09:22 <vmassol> regressions are always important?  
09:23 <cjd> I want to push out a release which contains ... regressions  
09:23 <cjd> ;)  
09:23 <vmassol> oh  
09:23 <vmassol> indeed  
09:23 <vmassol> important regression \*fixes\*  
09:23 <vmassol> ;)  
09:23 <vmassol> or "it fixes lots of important regressions"  
09:24 <vmassol> nice catch  
09:24 <cjd> yeap  
09:24 <cjd> I just saw it and laughed  
09:24 <vmassol> hehe  
09:24 <vmassol> it might actually be true :)  
09:25 <vmassol> future will tell  
09:25 <cjd> /nod  
09:26 <cjd> oh re what we were talking about the other day, I think the best way to do modularity via .jar files is to have them register a single "point of entry" object when they are loaded  
09:27 <cjd> that object can have methods for constructing all of the other parts which are available in that .jar module  
09:27 <vmassol> we almost do that with our components  
09:27 <vmassol> each module usually provides a main component that does this module's job  
09:28 <vmassol> (we also provide another one for scripting access)  
09:28 <cjd> perhaps instead of the annotation loader automatically knitting things together it could create the facade object  
09:28 <vmassol> well we want that automatic wiring :)  
09:29 <vmassol> that's why we took pain to develop it  
09:29 <vmassol> :)  
09:29 <cjd> >global variables  
09:30 <vmassol> what this facade object generates are your singeltons  
09:30 <cjd> the difference is that the configuration script is in charge  
09:30 <cjd> so technically they are not singletons  
09:31 <cjd> and when that "init script" becomes ugly and large, it is very obvious that refactoring is needed  
09:31 <cjd> whereas the DI method causes the mess to be spread around and hidden  
09:32 <vmassol> I think if you wish to change things in xwiki the best is that you write a proposal and take an existing example of oode from xwiki and show us how you would write it  
09:32 <vmassol> take some "clean" module ofc  
09:32 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <cjd> I don't think a proposal would get traction at the moment, I just want to talk about the general ideas until clean design is in the air ;)  
09:33 <vmassol> it's always in the air :)  
09:33 <vmassol> but right now you're the only one seeing some big pain with what you have I think  
09:33 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <vmassol> s/what you/what we  
09:33 <vmassol> so you need to convince others, hard job :)  
09:34 <cjd> I think this is a problem which plagues most java projects though  
09:34 <cjd> global variables cause trouble  
09:34 <vmassol> first you need to express the problem  
09:34 <vmassol> saying global variables cause trouble is not enough  
09:34 <vmassol> so if you feel strongly I'd write a blog post if I were you  
09:35 <cjd> I actually did but it's only available in hyperboria  
09:35 <vmassol> :)  
09:35 <cjd> I was planning on forwarding it to the list but I feel I need a conclusion  
09:35 <vmassol> ok  
09:38 <vmassol> you should use scala cjd, I'm sure you'd love it  
09:38 <vmassol> just saw this tweet: "As a Java programmer, Scala has thought me the value of functional programming, that is to strive to avoid state and mutable data."  
09:38 <cjd> Actually I like the general syntax and ideals but the compile time is scary  
09:38 <cjd> we need a scala compiler in C  
09:38 <cjd> Fabio told me the same thing  
09:39 <cjd> (that I should use it, not that we need a GCC frontend)  
09:39 <vmassol> you could contribute a scala macro for xwiki ;)  
09:39 <vmassol> there might be a JSR232 impl somewhere  
09:39 <vmassol> 223  
09:40 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5654888/how-do-i-set-up-jsr223-scripting-with-scala-as-scripting-language  
09:41 <vmassol> https://issues.scala-lang.org/browse/SI-874  
09:41 <cjd> nice  
09:47 <j-simard> has left #xwiki  
09:52 <sburjan> has quit  
09:53 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <tekzilla> has quit  
10:59 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <vmassol> mflorea: hi, do you know if this test failure is a flicker: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-5.2.x/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/32/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.appwithinminutes/ClassEditorTest/testRenameWithSaveAndContinue/  
11:16 <vmassol> I'd like to start releasing 5.2.1  
11:18 <vmassol> tmortagne: I see that http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9622 is not fixed yet  
11:18 <vmassol> I think I remember a discussion between Anca and you on skype  
11:18 <vmassol> you made some fix for 5.3M1 AFAIR  
11:18 <vmassol> do you think you could backport it to 5.2.1?  
11:19 <vmassol> not the whole thing but just the part that fixes it  
11:20 <vmassol> (since I think you said the whole thing is too dangerous)  
11:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: no I did not do a fix for that, I did some clean that made this bug desappear as a side effect but the conclusion of the discussion with Anca was that we needed a different fix for 5.2  
11:20 <tmortagne> vmassol: the fix for 5.2 according to anca is to revert your commit basically as explaining in the comment she wrote  
11:21 <tmortagne> I have to move, back in 1/2h  
11:21 <vmassol> ok I need to check my commit because I don't remember working on anythin in this domain  
11:21 <tmortagne> it's something you did for auth without cookie  
11:22 <tmortagne> so it's only part of your commit(s) on the subject  
11:22 <vmassol> ok  
11:22 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:22 <vmassol> only the change in MyFormAuthenticator  
11:22 <vmassol> right?  
11:22 <vmassol> ah tool ate  
11:23 <mflorea> vmassol: from the screenshot it seems the test timed out while waiting for a long Save & Continue. I haven't seen this test failing before, but I think it's a flicker, maybe the CI was very busy/slow when the test run.  
11:23 <vmassol> ok thanks mflorea  
11:28 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <sdumitriu> has quit  
11:49 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <sburjan> Hello. Seems we have some issues with out blog app from xwiki.org http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/News?page=2&ipp=3 Clicking on older post deosn't work  
12:09 <vmassol> could you try to fix it sburjan?  
12:10 <vmassol> (I'm releasing 5.2.1 now and fixing some bugs first)  
12:10 <sburjan> vmassol: I don't have the time, sorry  
12:10 <vmassol> then report it  
12:10 <vmassol> XINFRA  
12:15 <sburjan> vmassol: done  
12:15 <vmassol> thx  
12:15 <npst> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <mflorea> has quit  
12:16 <npst> smee again :)  
12:16 <npst> this time, i'm looking for a way to replace umlauts in links.  
12:17 <npst> i stumbled over the radeox replacement thing, but am wondering if there's a different way to do it  
12:20 <npst> like .. basically i want to prevent users to create wiki-pages with umlauts in the title. so maybe the page-creation is a place to look?  
12:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <camil7> why should users not create pages with umlauts in the page name ?  
12:25 <camil7> aside of that one need to fix it in page rename, page copy, etc pp  ... or do it on a "low level", which I guess means patching the core  
12:27 <npst> well, we've set everything from os over software up to the db to utf-8 and are still experiencing encoding problems with urls. so the replacing seemed to be a way to solve that  
12:47 <npst> is there a list of all those /XWiki/ pages (templates?) that contain logic and layout of certain sections of the site?  
12:47 <npst> like /XWiki/XWikiUserProfileSheet  
12:54 <ekarlso> has quit  
12:54 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <camil7> npst: the create page stuff actually lives on the file system, in webapps/xwiki/templates/create.vm  and createinline.vm ... I think one can override them by attaching a file with the same name to XWiki.DefaultSkin, but maybe some javascript hooks to prevent things in the UI is a bit smaller a change  
13:18 <camil7> aside if that umlauts should be working; it is a bug if they do not, imo  
13:33 <vmassol> note that several pages on xwiki.org are now broken due to the move of the XEM jira project  
13:33 <vmassol> because we renamed it to "{RETIRED} XWiki Enterprise Manager"  
13:33 <vmassol> I guess ideally we should have used its id  
13:34 <vmassol> also some RN are wrong now since we used "category = top level projects"  
13:34 <vmassol> and XEM was moved from top level to retired  
13:35 <vmassol> several jira filters are also broken because of this  
13:35 <vmassol> I guess using dynamic content for release notes is an issue...  
13:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:59 <npst> thanks, camil7: in what file would i place that js, tho?  
14:00 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea: any idea if there's a risk for me to update the translations for 5.2.1?  
14:00 <vmassol> (ie some keys removed for example)  
14:00 <vmassol> if I didn't want to take any risk I think I shouldn't update translations  
14:01 <vmassol> actually I think we probably shouldn't update translations for bug fix releases…. wdyt?  
14:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: we are never supposed to remove translations  
14:01 <tmortagne> that would be a bug  
14:01 <vmassol> sure but it can happen  
14:01 <tmortagne> it usually don't happen or we fix it  
14:01 <vmassol> if we know about it  
14:01 <vmassol> here we wouldn't know  
14:01 <camil7> npst: I thought about javascript emedded in xwiki, as explained there:  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial#HMinimalJavaScripteXtension   ... not sure if it is the ideal solution, would have to "smell" on every pag if there is an add/copy/rename form with a page name input field  
14:01 <vmassol> nobody has tested 5.2.1SNAP  
14:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: then how can we answer you :)  
14:02 <vmassol> for ex if you know for sure you removed some key  
14:02 <vmassol> for some reason  
14:02 <mflorea> vmassol: I think there are some translation changes that work only in 5.3M1+  
14:02 <vmassol> yep that too  
14:02 <vmassol> ie some parameter changed  
14:02 <tmortagne> if that's the case it's wrong too  
14:03 <tmortagne> when changing paramater we are supposed to add new jey  
14:03 <tmortagne> key  
14:03 <vmassol> this is why I think it's always sangerous to update translations for bug fix releases  
14:03 <mflorea> Edy or Louis-Marie have removed wiki syntax from translation values and update the Velocity code in 5.3M1 so they won't work in 5.2.1  
14:03 <npst> well, i guess i  
14:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: there's a big difference between we shouldn't do it and we have no tool to check it  
14:03 <npst> 'll try some different approaches. maybe even some apache reqrite would suffice :D  
14:03 <mflorea> for WorkspaceManager  
14:03 <npst> thanks again, great channel :>  
14:03 <tmortagne> mflorea: I'm pretty sure guillaume did not break translation keys  
14:03 <tmortagne> I talking with him about it several times  
14:04 <mflorea> then Edy, let me find the commit  
14:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: would you be confident enough to do a 5.2.2 release in case something is broken? :)  
14:04 <tmortagne> s/talking/talked/  
14:05 <vmassol> I think we need to develop some build time tool to check breakages in translation keys  
14:05 <vmassol> s/we need/we might need  
14:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: if you don't want to update translation don't  
14:05 <vmassol> some kind of "CLIRR for translations"  
14:05 <vmassol> that's hte problem  
14:05 <vmassol> we don't have some fixed rule for tht  
14:05 <vmassol> \*that  
14:06 <tmortagne> we do have rules, now people should follow them  
14:06 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/dfe91d79e7b6c91c688353e213ac78d9fcf39b33  
14:06 <vmassol> do we?  
14:06 <vmassol> I don't remember that  
14:06 <Denis> has quit  
14:06 <vmassol> url?  
14:06 <mflorea> it was Edy, so if you update translations then you have to skip WorkspaceManager translations  
14:07 <vmassol> thanks a lot mflorea  
14:07 <vmassol> you saved me from a 5.2.2  
14:07 <vmassol> I'm not going to update translations  
14:07 <mflorea> ok, np  
14:07 <vmassol> I had done the improts and was about to push the changes  
14:07 <vmassol> now cleaning....  
14:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: translation keys are APIs and we are not supposed to break APIs  
14:10 <vmassol> that's not the problem  
14:11 <vmassol> the problem is that we don't have CLIRR for translations  
14:11 <vmassol> as mflorea just shown wishful thinking is not enough  
14:12 <vmassol> so it's quite a big risk to udpate translations  
14:12 <vmassol> actually  
14:12 <vmassol> either we should develop some tools for checking backward comapt issues or define some rules such as:  
14:12 <vmassol> - no transaltion upgrade for bugfix release  
14:12 <vmassol> - no translation update after M2  
14:13 <vmassol> ofc tool would be best but I don't know how complex that would be to write  
14:13 <vmassol> someone would need to explore  
14:13 <vmassol> may not be that hard  
14:26 <vmassol> evalica: nice design app on design.xwiki.org. I hope you'll be able to release it on contrib and on e.x.o once it's ready :)  
14:27 <evalica> vmassol: there are lots of things I want to do :) especially make it even nicer. Right now I'm trying to fix the pages and go over them (I know it mayeb was not needed, but I will have a sense or organization over them). After I need to finish and import also incubator.  
14:35 <vmassol> evalica: btw in case you don't know, the parents are wrong, but this can be fixed easily with a script to fix them all at once  
14:37 <evalica> they are not wrong …  
14:37 <evalica> I mean there are the old parents set to Design.WebHome  
14:38 <evalica> and I will mark manually parent for pages that I know relate to one another  
14:38 <evalica> and after we can fix them if we want them to be marked on Main.WebHome or Proposal.WebHome  
14:39 <evalica> vmassol: anyway the parents are needed for Feature's pages in order to display a meaningful livetable for the requirements | design | implementation related pages  
14:57 <evalica> vmassol: Do you know why we have a DesignArchive space? http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SpaceIndex?space=DesignArchive Who created it and what was the purpose? For example OfficeImporter exists in both spaces Design and DesignArchive http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DesignArchive/OfficeImporter  
14:58 <vmassol> evalica: I created it  
14:58 <vmassol> initially it was containing all finished designs  
14:58 <vmassol> but then I improved the design app  
14:58 <vmassol> and decide to have a status field  
14:58 <vmassol> \*decided  
14:58 <vmassol> and I've moved them back to the design space  
14:59 <vmassol> I'm surprised that the DesignArchivr still exist, let me check  
14:59 <evalica> ok - since the page is a duplicate I will delete and when I'll find the other I'll see what do to with it.  
14:59 <vmassol> ah only 2 pages  
15:00 <vmassol> I don't know, probably a leftover  
15:00 <evalica> I'm letting you check out the status and after I will delete the pages I found duplicate or move them manually. Thanks  
15:00 <evalica> :) it's nice that there are just 2 :P  
15:27 <camil7> has left #xwiki  
15:28 <vmassol> grrrrr build failed on a1 for the 5.2.1 release for platform  
15:56 <npst> has quit  
16:10 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:24 <sburjan> has quit  
16:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <vmassol> I'm sad…. platform build failed again…. further this time  
16:29 <cjd> vmassol: tmortagne https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/java/javadoc/com/google/apphosting/api/DeadlineExceededException?csw=1  
16:29 <cjd> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13883166/uncatchable-chucknorrisexception  
16:29 <cjd> looks possible if you can hack around the bytecode verifier  
16:30 <vmassol> JVM crash  
16:30 <vmassol> caused by gwt  
16:31 <vmassol> interesting gwt command line: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7372677/raw/027bae7c49bb5889bb15df438caf4f0f7c02cd99/gistfile1.txt  
16:31 <vmassol> classpath is pretty long  
16:32 <cjd> yuck  
16:32 <cjd> nasty GWT  
16:33 <cjd> I know it's technically java's fault but the magic in gwt is annoying  
16:33 <vmassol> yes I really don't like generators  
16:34 <vmassol> they're hacks  
16:34 <vmassol> for a core issue  
16:35 <cjd>  /bin/sh -c /home/hudsonagent/jdk1.6.0\_33/jre/bin/java -Xmx1024m -Xss1024k <-- 1M is small for a stack size  
16:35 <cjd> try 8M  
16:35 <cjd> you might have overrun the garbage collector's stack which is C++ so it doesn't throw a stack overflow error  
16:36 <cjd> there used to be a nice little piece of code which went something like:   Object[] x = null; for (;;) { x = new Object[] {x}; }  
16:36 <cjd> would cause a segfault  
16:36 <cjd> because of the GC  
16:36 <vmassol> mflorea: should I do what cjd suggests and change           <extraJvmArgs>-Xmx1024m -Xss1024k -Djava.awt.headless=true</extraJvmArgs> in the wysiwyg war pom?  
16:37 <cjd> they fixed that IIRC  
16:41 <mflorea> vmassol: from your log the GWT compilation has just started, not even a permutation computed, so I doubt it's related to GWT  
16:41 <vmassol> the command line was started  
16:41 <vmassol> and failed  
16:41 <vmassol> we just don't know where  
16:42 <vmassol> mflorea: so you think the stack size is not an issue  
16:42 <vmassol> ?  
16:43 <mflorea> yes, I don't think it's the issue, it crashed before starting the heavy work  
16:43 <mflorea> but you can try nevertheless  
16:43 <vmassol> actually it seems that marge xss values can cause crashes  
16:44 <vmassol> http://www.avricot.com/blog/?post/2010/05/03/Get-started-with-java-JVM-memory-(heap%2C-stack%2C-xss-xms-xmx-xmn...)  
16:45 <vmassol> after some reading I also don't think it would change anything  
16:55 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:08 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <sburjan> has quit  
17:12 <vmassol> mflorea/cjd: in the end I've jsut restarted without any change, so far it's at permutation 30  
17:13 <cjd> an indeterminent segfault :|  
17:13 <cjd> http://catb.org/jargon/html/magic-story.html  
17:29 <mflorea> has quit  
17:53 <vmassol> mf   
17:53 <vmassol> oops
